Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Everyone needs to get fired up by brisk, racy and mineral-driven Chardonnays like these—they're the future. Aromas of just-ripe apple, Meyer lemon zest, white flower and stone drop into a palate of wet concrete, tight pear and delicate honeydew.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Samuel Louis Smith 2021 Spear Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This bottling from a vineyard near Highway 101 is driven by an intense minerality, boasting damp earth and crushed rock aromas alongside lime pith. The palate is marvelously stony in both flavor and texture, sizzling with yellow-grapefruit and more high-toned citrus flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2020 Olsen Prunetucky Sands Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Ben Lomond Mountain, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From vines planted in 2005 at 1,800 feet just 4.5 miles from the ocean, this bottling showcases this mountainous coast in all its glory. Aromas of lemon jelly and sliced apple lead into a chalky palate, where bright and zesty citrus flavors ride an intense acidity into the firm finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beauregard 2021 Beauregard Ranch Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)

Description: This superrich and mouthcoating wine is also silky in texture and has a light, lifting acidity to give it great balance. Poached pears, marzipan and a touch of butter give it full flavors to pair with sauteed fish, broiled shellfish or to savor by itself.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cattleya 2021 Cuvée Number Five Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet river-stone, lemon-blossom and light honeysuckle aromas draw the nose into this delicate bottling that will age with grace and poise. The stony, mineral-driven palate picks up touches of chalk, tangerine and vibrant Meyer lemon freshness. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Farm Cottage 2021 Trout Gulch Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)Cellar Selection

Appellation: Ben Lomond Mountain, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From vines planted in 1989 at about 1,000 feet above the sea in sandy soils, this bottling grabs immediate attention and doesn't let go. Aromas of wet chalk, citrus zest and melon rind lead into a palate loaded with bright flavors of wet clay and zingy Eureka lemon peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beauregard 2021 Bald Mountain Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)Editors' Choice
